attributes.name: schemas
attributes.description: The schemas attribute is an array of Strings which allows introspection of the supported schema version for a SCIM representation as well any schema extensions supported by that representation.  Each String value must be a unique URI.  This specification defines URIs for User, Group, and a standard "enterprise" extension.  All representations of SCIM schema MUST include a non-zero value array with value(s) of the URIs supported by that representation.  Duplicate values MUST NOT be included.  Value order is not specified and MUST not impact behavior.  REQUIRED.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The schema's human readable name.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The schema's human readable description

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description: A complex type that specifies the set of Resources attributes

subAttributes.name: description
subAttributes.description: The attribute's human readable description.

subAttributes.name: referenceTypes
subAttributes.description: The names of the Resource Types that may be referenced; e.g., User. This is only applicable for attributes that are of the "reference" data type.

subAttributes.name: readOnly
subAttributes.description: A Boolean value that specifies if the attribute is mutable.

subAttributes.name: type
subAttributes.description: The attribute's data type; e.g., String.

subAttributes.name: required
subAttributes.description: A Boolean value that specifies if the attribute is required.

subAttributes.name: subAttributes
subAttributes.description: A list specifying the contained attributes.

subAttributes.name: name
subAttributes.description: The attribute's name

subAttributes.name: multiValued
subAttributes.description: Boolean value indicating the attribute's plurality.

subAttributes.name: caseExact
subAttributes.description: A Boolean value that specifies if the String attribute is case sensitive.

attributes.name: schema
attributes.description: The resource type schema

attributes.name: endpoint
attributes.description: The resource type endpoint

attributes.description: The resource type name

attributes.name: description

attributes.description: The resource type schema extensions

subAttributes.name: schema
subAttributes.description: The URI of an extended schema.

subAttributes.name: required
subAttributes.description: Indicates whether the extension is required for the resource type.

attributes.name: challenges
attributes.description: The challenge questions and answers.

subAttributes.name: response
subAttributes.description: The response part of the challenge question.

subAttributes.name: challenge
subAttributes.description: The question part of the challenge question.

attributes.name: passwd
attributes.description: The password attribute containing old/new values and notifications

subAttributes.name: userMustChangePasswordAtNextLogin
subAttributes.description: if true, user does not need to change the password at next login

subAttributes.name: oldValue
subAttributes.description: Old password

subAttributes.name: sendNotification
subAttributes.description: Controls if notification is sent or not following operation

subAttributes.name: sendNotificationTo
subAttributes.description: Controls list of whom to send notification to if 'sendNotification' flag is set

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: New password

Resources.name: UserApplication
Resources.description: Custom schema extension for user application instances

subAttributes.name: applicationName
subAttributes.description: Name of the application instance

subAttributes.name: applicationAttributes
subAttributes.description: Attributes for the application instance account

subAttributes.name: name
subAttributes.description: Attribute name (label from OIG)

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: Attribute value

subAttributes.name: entitlements
subAttributes.description: Entitlements associated with the application instance

subAttributes.name: entitlementNamespace
subAttributes.description: Namespace of the entitlement (e.g. UD_OUD)

subAttributes.name: entitlementName
subAttributes.description: Name of the entitlement

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Search filter: only resource matching the filter will be returned.

attributes.name: startIndex
attributes.description: The index of the first search result.

attributes.name: schemas
attributes.description: The schemas attribute is an array of Strings which allows introspection of the supported schema version for a SCIM representation as well any schema extensions supported by that representation.  Each String value must be a unique URI.  This specification defines URIs for User, Group, and a standard "enterprise" extension.  All representations of SCIM schema MUST include a non-zero value array with value(s) of the URIs supported by that representation.  Duplicate values MUST NOT be included.  Value order is not specified and MUST not impact behavior.  REQUIRED.

attributes.name: sortOrder
attributes.description: The attribute whose value is used to order returned response.

attributes.name: count
attributes.description: The desired number of search result per page.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description: List of attributes to return.

attributes.name: sortBy
attributes.description: The attribute whose value is used to order returned response.

attributes.name: excludedAttributes
attributes.description: List of attributes to remove from the response.

attributes.name: organization
attributes.description: Identifies the name of an organization.

attributes.name: preferredLanguage
attributes.description: Indicates the User's preferred written or spoken language. Generally used for selecting a localized User interface. Valid values are concatenation of the ISO 639-1 two letter language code, an underscore, and the ISO 3166-1 2 letter country code; e.g., 'en_US' specifies the language English and country US.

attributes.name: groups
attributes.description: A list of groups that the user belongs to, either thorough direct membership, nested groups, or dynamically calculated.  The values are meant to enable expression of common group or role based access control models, although no explicit authorization model is defined.  It is intended that the semantics of group membership and any behavior or authorization granted as a result of membership are defined by the Service Provider.  The Canonical types "direct" and "indirect" are defined to describe how the group membership was derived.  Direct group membership indicates the User is directly associated with the group and SHOULD indicate that Consumers may modify membership through the Group Resource.  Indirect membership indicates User membership is transitive or dynamic and implies that Consumers cannot modify indirect group membership through the Group resource but MAY modify direct group membership through the Group resource which MAY influence indirect memberships.  If the SCIM Service Provider exposes a Group resource, the value MUST be the "id" attribute of the corresponding Group resources to which the user belongs.  Since this attribute is read-only, group membership changes MUST be applied via the Group Resource.
